bug.short_desc: link to release notes missing from Fx4 firstrun page (and from Fx4 menus)

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
There is no link to the release notes from the Firefox 4 firstrun/Welcome page, which in my case is:
http://www.mozilla.com/sv-SE/firefox/4.0/firstrun
also missing from http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/4.0/firstrun
This is especially bad because a link to the release notes is nowhere to be found in the menus of Firefox 4 itself. Not in the "About" window, and not in any of the pages opened by entries in the "Help" menu. (I'll file a separate bug on Firefox regarding this.)
Reproducible: Always
Expected Results: There should be an easily found link to the release notes.
FWIW, I've received comments that it was very difficult to find the release notes on the Firefox download site from people emailing the mozilla.org webmaster address.

I see now there's a release notes link on the Swedish "Features" page, which is prominently linked from the Swedish firstrun page. Good enough.
-- But starting the en-US browser, I can't find a release notes link anywhere by navigating from the firstrun page.
I notice that if I navigate to http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/central/ , there's no release notes link below the green download link, but if I paste in for example the address http://www.mozilla-europe.org/en/firefox/features/ , a release notes link appears below the green download link on that page. This is using the en-US browser.
But this is already reported Bug 643952.
-- For this bug, I think a link on a prominent secondary page would be good enough (even though I would prefer it to be on the firstrun page), so I will accept a wontfix.

But, of course, the release notes link attached to a download link, I suppose it links to the release notes for the version to be downloaded (the currently latest version). But what I am requesting is a link to the release notes for the currently _used_ browser.
So, what I said was "Good enough" above is not really good enough, since it is a link to the release notes for the version to be downloaded, and not for the currently used version.
